flawed_nl_solution:
He has 30*6=<<30*6=180>>180 students
So he needs to buy 180*10=<<180*10=1800>>1800 index cards
That means he needs to buy 1800/50=<<1800/50=63>>63 packs of index cards
So he spends 63*3=$<<63*3=189>>189
#### 189

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 36, not 63. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
